org.askalon.jlibcloud.compute.core

Class ComputeContextBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.askalon.jlibcloud.compute.core.ComputeContextBuilder

  • public class ComputeContextBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to instanciate a ComputeContext class. Using Providers a ComputeContext for EC2 can be instantiated with the following code:

      • credentialsFromFile

        public ComputeContextBuilder credentialsFromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        laod the credentials from a file. For an example File see: libcloud-trunk/javaimpl/compute/secrets.py-dist

        If this method is used, all other credentials methods are ignored.

        Parameters:
        filePath - trys to load the driver credentials from the file
        Returns:
        this ComputeContextBuilder

      • credentialsFromFile

        public ComputeContextBuilder credentialsFromFile()

        Returns:
        this ComputeContextBuilder

      • nodePropertiesFrom

        public ComputeContextBuilder nodePropertiesFrom(java.lang.String filepath)
        Loads a given properties file for the ComputeContext from the given filepath. The ComputeContext uses the properties when creating a node, if the required fields in the NodeTemplate are uninitialized.

        For valid attribute names use the Javadoc name from NodeTemplate.class or the NodeTemplateBuilder.class. Allowed fields for the standard ComputeContext are: 

         name=nodeName
 image_id=someImage
 size_id=someSize
 location_id=location
 ex_keyname=someKey
        In general for the ComputeContext and derived classes alls String, int, boolean and float values can be read from a .properties file. List\ or String[] values can also be read. Therfore add an an index from [0,14] to the attribute name. for example: 
         ex_security_groups0=group1
 ex_security_groups1=group2
 ex_security_groups2=group3
        Parameters:
        filepath - path to the .properties file
        Returns:
        this ComputeContextBuilder

      • build

        public ComputeContext build()
        Returns:
        the appropriate ComputeContext instance.

      • create

        public <T extends ComputeContext> T create(java.lang.String module,
                                  java.lang.String importKlass,
                                  java.lang.Class<T> targetKlass)
        perform the actual coercion of the referenced python class into Java bytecode
        Parameters:
        module - the module name within the javaimpl.compute package. e.g. drivers.AbiquoComputeContext
        importKlass - the class name from the module e.g. AbiquoComputeContextImpl
        targetKlass - the java interface e.g. AbiquoComputeContext.class
        Returns:
        the implemented targetKlass

      • getJarPath

        public java.lang.String getJarPath()
        Returns:
        the absolute path (including destination in jar) of this class.
